testsuite.name: SDK initialiation
testsuite.details: SDK initialiation without list of placement

testcase.name: Check auto-cached placement ID
testcase.summary: Check auto-cached placement ID
testcase.preconditions: 1.Install vungle app.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83] [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for Auto-cached placement ID.
step.expectedresults:
1.All active placement id should be displayed on testapp as well as on config response which is associated with Pub APP ID.

2.Auto-cached placement id should be auto-cached /preload without tapping on load button.

testcase.name: Non Auto-cached Placement
testcase.summary: Check non auto-cached placement ID
testcase.preconditions: 1. Install app.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for non Auto-cached placement ID.
step.expectedresults:
1.All active placement id should be displayed on testapp as well as on config response which is associated with Pub APP ID.

2.Placement id should not be autocached/preload.

testcase.name: One or zero auto-cached placement ID
testcase.summary: Check for one or zero auto-cached placement IDs form dashboard.
testcase.preconditions: Vungle app should be installed.

step.actions:
1.Create Pub ID from dashboard.

2.Check for one or zero Auto-cached placement ID.

3.Enter Pub App ID [i.e 5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

4.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

5.Initialise the SDK.
step.expectedresults:
1.If auto-cached checkbox is check, only one placement is should be selected as a auto-cached placement id.

2.If auto-cached checkbox is unchecked, no placement is should be auto-cached/preload.

testcase.name: Update Placement list
testcase.summary: Check updated placement list in SDK
testcase.preconditions:
1.Vungle app should be installed.
2.Update existing placement id name.

step.actions:
1)Enter Pub APP ID in app having updated placement id's and initialize the SDK.

2) Observe placement id name displayed in config response.
step.expectedresults: Updated placement ID's should get displayed in config response when SDK is initialized.

testcase.name: SDK initialise
testcase.summary: Check SDK initialise
testcase.preconditions: 1.Vungle app should be installed.

step.actions:
1) Enter valid Pub APP ID & End points

2)Tap on start button
step.expectedresults: 1) SDK should initialize successfully

testcase.name: Initialize the SDK with invalid pub app ID.
testcase.summary: Check invalid Pub App ID.
testcase.preconditions: 1.Vungle app should be installed.

step.actions:
1) Enter invalid Pub APP ID & End points

2)Tap on start button
step.expectedresults: User should not be able to initialise SDK with invalid Pub App ID.

testcase.name: Pub app ID having multiple placement ids.
testcase.summary: Check limitations of placement ids in Pub App ID.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Vungle app should be installed.

2.Pub app ID should have multiple placement ids when checked from dashboard.

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check for placement ids in Pub App ID. For Example:-Pub App ID having 30/40 placement ids.
step.expectedresults:
1.All active placement id should be displayed on testapp as well as on config response which is associated with Pub APP ID.

2.There should not be any limitation to displayed placement id's.

3.Every listed placement id should have ads associted with it.

testcase.name: Check 'is_auto_cached' parameter in config response
testcase.summary: Check 'is_auto_cached' parameter in config response.
testcase.preconditions: SDK version should be 5.1.0 or 5.1.0+

step.actions:
1.Enter Pub App ID [i.e5a41e8deeca5a79137000f83]

2.Enter end-points [i.e:https://apiqa.vungle.com/api/v5]

3.Initialise the SDK.

4.Check config response.
step.expectedresults:
1.'is_auto_cached' parameter should be present in config response.

2.By default 'is_auto_cached' parameter's value  should be 'false' in config response.

3.If 'is_auto_cached' parameter's value is 'true' then ad should get auto-cached/preload.

4.If 'is_auto_cached' parameter's value is 'false' then none of the placement should get auto-cached/preload.

testcase.name: Auto-Cache with more than one Placement
testcase.summary: Auto-Cache with more than one Placement
testcase.preconditions: App id should contain multiple placement id's

step.actions:
1. Manipulate "is_auto_cached" parameter as "True" for all placement id's in config response.
2. Initialize app
3. Observe Auto cache functionality
step.expectedresults:
1. All placement id's should load automatically.
2. Manual intervention should not be required to load ad.
3. Ad should get loaded automatically and user should be able to play ad

testcase.name: Kill the app while multi auto-cache is loading
testcase.summary: To verify Kill the app while multi auto-cache is loading
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install App
2. Initialize app

step.actions:
1. Initialize the app
2. Kill the app while the auto-caching is loading
3. Re-initialize the app
step.expectedresults:
auto-caching must be paused when the app is killed
App should resume auto-caching only that have not been auto-cached when the app is killed.

testcase.name: App initializing
testcase.summary: Check response in charles after App initialize
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1)Install the App on iOS device and set charles Proxy.  
2)Enter the Pub App Id.
3)Initialize the SDK.
4)Observe the charles.
step.expectedresults:
1. App should get initialized.
  2. Config API should get called.
  3. SDK should download an Ad for the placement id when auto cache flag is enabled.

testcase.name: Ad Unit Caching
testcase.summary: Check caching of multiple Ad's
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1)Install the App on iOS device and set charles Proxy.  
2)Enter the Pyb App Id.
3)Initialize the SDK.
4)Observe the charles. 
5)Play the Ads.
6)Repeat 3,4,5
step.expectedresults:
1) SDK should download multiple Ads for all placement id's with respect to placement priority. 
2) If 2 Placements have the same Metadata the Ad should not be downloaded twice.
3) If an Ad is already downloaded and if the App tries to download an Ad with same meta data, the SDK should use the Cached Ad and not download again.
4) Based on the Auto Cache Flag in the test app, The ad for the particular placement id will be downloaded automatically.
 
Note:- 
This will happen only when Metadata for 2 Ad's is the same

testcase.name: Callback for loadad request when SDK is in sleep state
testcase.summary: This test is to verify AND-808
testcase.preconditions:
SDK initiallized with more than one placement

Charles rewrite /api/v5/ads reponse with "sleep" reponse

{
    "ads": [{
        "placement_reference_id": "your placement ID goes here",
        "ad_markup": {
            "id": "",
            "campaign": null,

testsuite.name: Streaming Ad (All devices)

testcase.name: Config buffer_timeout (buffer time for streaming Ad)
testcase.summary: Check for Config buffer_timeout
testcase.preconditions:
• Initialise the App
  • Play Ad

step.actions: 1)Set "buffer_timeout" parameter value as 250/300 in responce payload of Config. 2)Initialise the App and play the Add
step.expectedresults:
1) buffer_timeout means Number of seconds to buffer when streaming.

2) The SDK tries to stream however it is expected to fail. The screen blinks then the SDK goes back to the home screen.

testcase.name: Mainpulate the "will_play_ad": { "enabled": true/false
testcase.summary: Mainpulate & check"will_play_ad": { "enabled": true/false
testcase.preconditions:
1. Set Charles proxy. 
  2. Initialise the App 
  3. Observe the Charles.

step.actions:
1. Set "enabled" parameter value as true/false in response payload of Config.
  2. Initialise the App and play the Add
step.expectedresults:
1. enable = false:  then no streaming Ads are played, only cached Could be local or MRAID depending on type
  2. enable = true: Streaming Ad should play

testcase.name: Manipulate threshold time parameter"request_timeout" for Streaming Ad
testcase.summary: Manipulate the "request_timeout" parameter
testcase.preconditions:
1. Set Charles proxy.
  2. Initialise the App 
  3. Observe the Charles.

step.actions: 1)Set "buffer_timeout" parameter value as 250/300 in response payload of Config. 2)Initialise the App and play the Add.
step.expectedresults: First, the SDK tries to stream an Ad then If requestStreamingAd is not returned within this threshold in milliseconds, a cached Ad is played Cached Ad could be local or MRAID depending on AdType

  • If you tap on close, the Ad should be closed.
  • If you tap on continue, the Ad should be resumed.

testcase.name: Close button behavior for MRAID video
testcase.summary: Based on "INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" and "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" parameter value, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions:
1. Set Charles proxy.
  2. Initialise the App 
  3. play ad
  4. Observe the Charles.

step.actions: 1)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", 2)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", 3)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", set thees value in Ads response API
step.expectedresults: 1) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 5. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button. 2) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is skippable close button; otherwise, it should delay for 5 seconds. 3) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 9999 which is skippable close button.. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button.

testcase.name: App not to be crash when it's in background
testcase.summary: Check for An app shouldn't crash while in the background
testcase.preconditions:
1. Set Charles proxy.
  2. Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Start Test app Init SDK and play an ad

2)Send app to the background for 5 minutes

3)Play video and send to background. While playing the video, swipe down notifications, video should pause. Swipe back notifications, the video should now resume. Android: When the device's lock screen is set to none(Settings->Security->Screen lock none on Android devices), play video, off/lock the device, on/unlock the device again, the video should resume after the device is unlocked
step.expectedresults: The App shouldn't crash at any point

testcase.name: Broken point- when "MP4" assets are broken
testcase.summary: Check how the SDK should try to send "Ad" again, when "MP4" assets are broken.

2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1) Prepare broken asset (example, make simple text file ("brokenAsset.txt"), and rename it as "brokenAsset.mp4", and upload to local server.
2)Prepare "Ad" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asser you prepared in #1.
3)Start Test app
4)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
5)Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
Test the same thing for "will_play_Ad" case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash.

2.Initialise the App

2)Start Test App
3)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return response with Null values
4)Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: The SDK should keep retrying requesting Ads until a valid request is retrieved

2)initialize the App

step.actions:
1)Install the App on Android/iOS device and set charles Proxy.  
2)initialize the App
step.expectedresults:
The SDK should honor the Force View Setting for native ads
 
Example: if  the ad is set to true for force view, SDK should always play an native AD that cannot be closed by the user before the video is complete, and opposite for Force view set to false.

testcase.name: Flexview Ad Close timer option
testcase.summary: Check for the adDuration parameter of Flexview ad.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.

2.Initialise the App

step.actions:
1. Install the App.

2. Initialise the App.

3. Configure flexview close timer value(Eg. 20 sec) in flexview ad.

4. Load and play ad.

5. Lock the device before flexview close timer value(Eg. 10 sec).

6. Unlock the device after flexview close timer value (Eg. 25 sec).

7. Observe the request payload of report ad.
step.expectedresults:
1. All the parameter of the request payload should contain specified value associated with it. (adDuration, videoViewed)

2. None of the parameter of the should contain negative or '0' value.(Ad duration, videoViewed).
